abstract: Volatility returned to Wall Street on Monday, ending a four-day winning streak for stocks, as worries over the energy sector overshadowed hopes that banks would continue to bring in generous profits, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Volatility returned to Wall Street on Monday, ending a four-day winning streak for stocks, as worries over the energy sector overshadowed hopes that banks would continue to bring in generous profits, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Volatility returned to Wall Street on Monday, ending a four-day winning streak for stocks, as worries over the energy sector overshadowed hopes that banks would continue to bring in generous profits.

headline.main: Wall Street Exchanges Turn Lower in Closing Minutes

abstract: BrightSource Energy, backed by Google and other companies, has won a a $1.37 billion loan guarantee from the United States Department of Energy to build a large-scale solar power plant in the California desert, The New York Times reported.
snippet: BrightSource Energy, backed by Google and other companies, has won a a $1.37 billion loan guarantee from the United States Department of Energy to build a large-scale solar power plant in the California desert, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: The United States Department of Energy offered a $1.37 billion loan guarantee on Monday to a California company planning to build a large-scale solar power plant in the Southern California desert, The New York Times’s Todd Woody reported.

headline.main: U.S. Offers Solar Project a Crucial Loan Guarantee
